content.question: Which of the following best describes the advantage of using hydrofluorocarbons (<math alttext="H F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) or hydrochlorofluorocarbons (<math alttext="H C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) to replace chlorofluorocarbons (<math alttext="C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) in industrial processes?

choices.label: <math alttext="H F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have lower ozone-depleting potentials than <math alttext="C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> do.

<math alttext="H F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are more stable than <math alttext="C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are in the atmosphere.

<math alttext="H F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are not classified as greenhouse gases but <math alttext="C F C s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are.

<math alttext="H F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are less expensive to produce than <math alttext="C F C s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are.

content.answer: <math alttext="H F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have lower ozone-depleting potentials than <math alttext="C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> do.
